issue.title: ROS commands don't match the actual iRobot hands

content.raw: For better accuracy, the 4 tendon motors "24 counts per motor revolution x 300 motor revolutions for one full spindle rotation." I didn't include that before because it doesn't convert to position directly without the geometry of the radius of the tendon on the motor spool, etc. But it can help to correlate to velocity, which is motor ticks per minute. For velocity 1000-2000 is a good range.
content.html: For better accuracy, the 4 tendon motors "24 counts per motor revolution x 300 motor revolutions for one full spindle rotation." I didn't include that before because it doesn't convert to position directly without the geometry of the radius of the tendon on the motor spool, etc. But it can help to correlate to velocity, which is motor ticks per minute. For velocity 1000-2000 is a good range.
